com.zendesk.sdk.network.impl

Enum ZendeskConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<ZendeskConfig>
      • com.zendesk.sdk.network.impl.ZendeskConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<ZendeskConfig>

    public enum ZendeskConfig
extends Enum<ZendeskConfig>
    Configuration class for Zendesk initialization. Call this first to configure Zendesk to use the correct credentials and Zendesk URL.

      • init

        public void init(Context context,
        String zendeskUrl,
        String applicationId,
        String oauthClientId)
        Initialises the Zendesk SDK

        Use this constructor when you have enabled the Conversations feature. This requires some authentication settings. Your zendeskUrl must be your full Zendesk URL in the form of https://{subdomain.zendesk.com You should replace {subdomain} with your own subdomain.

        This constructor will check if SdkSettings have already been retrieved from the server. If they are found it will set up a background service to request settings updates periodically. If no settings are available it will request them for the server and then initialise the background service to receive updates.

        Parameters:
        context - A context, used for initialising stored settings
        zendeskUrl - The full URL of your Zendesk instance, https://{subdomain}.zendesk.com
        applicationId - The application id of your SDK app, as found in the web interface
        oauthClientId - The oauth client id that was supplied when you set up oauth in the web interface
        Throws:
        ConfigurationRuntimeException - if context is null, the zendeskUrl is invalid or if the application id is not supplied.

      • getZendeskUrl

        public String getZendeskUrl()
        Gets the Zendesk URL.

        This is the URL in the form of https://{subdomain}.zendesk.com

        Returns:
        The Zendesk URL

      • getSdkSettings

        @Deprecated
public SdkSettings getSdkSettings()
        Deprecated. 
        Gets the SDK settings.

        This method will never return a null RateMyAppSettings. This is because it is only a container for the actual settings and it simplifies client code as they don't have to null check this container.

        Deprecated. Use getSettings() instead.

        Returns:
        the SDK settings. Please ensure the settings that it contains are not null such as RateMyAppSettings and others.

      • getSettings

        public MobileSettings getSettings()
        Gets the SDK settings.

        This method will never return a null RateMyAppSettings. This is because it is only a container for the actual settings and it simplifies client code as they don't have to null check this container.

        Returns:
        the SDK settings. Please ensure the settings that it contains are not null such as RateMyAppSettings and others.

      • isAuthenticationAvailable

        public boolean isAuthenticationAvailable()
        Determines whether the SDK has been configured to allow authentication.

        Certain SDK features such as RequestListFragment requires that an Identity has been initialised by calling setIdentity(com.zendesk.sdk.model.network.Identity)

        Returns:
        true if an end user is available, false otherwise

      • getApplicationId

        public String getApplicationId()
        Gets the application id.

        The application id is used to retrieve SdkSettings from your Zendesk instance.

        Returns:
        The application id or null if it was not previously set.

      • getContactConfiguration

        public ZendeskFeedbackConfiguration getContactConfiguration()
        Gets the Configuration for Contact component, if set this will be provided to the component for additional configuration.
        Returns:
        instance of ZendeskFeedbackConfiguration which will be used to augment the creation of a request, can be null

      • setContactConfiguration

        public void setContactConfiguration(ZendeskFeedbackConfiguration contactConfiguration)
        Sets the Configuration for the Contact component, if a non-null instance of ZendeskFeedbackConfiguration this will be used to provide a set of values to the Contact component to enhance the request creation.
        Parameters:
        contactConfiguration - instance of ZendeskFeedbackConfiguration to be passed to the configuration

      • setIdentity

        public void setIdentity(Identity identity)
        Sets the identity which the SDK uses to access and create resources
        Parameters:
        identity - Identity that the SDK will identify as

      • setCustomFields

        public void setCustomFields(List<CustomField> customFields)
        Set a List of type CustomField to be used on request submission until unset See Mobile SDK documentation for more information on setting this.
        Parameters:
        customFields - List contain CustomField objects which will be included as part of the request

      • getCustomFields

        public List<CustomField> getCustomFields()
        Gets the custom fields
        Returns:
        the list of custom fields or null if they have not been set

      • setTicketFormId

        public void setTicketFormId(Long ticketFormId)
        Set a ticket form id which will be included in all request submission until unset See Mobile SDK documentation for more information on setting this.
        Parameters:
        ticketFormId - Long of ticket form id

      • getTicketFormId

        public Long getTicketFormId()
        Gets the ticket form Id
        Returns:
        the ticket form id or null if it has not been set

      • setDeviceLocale

        public void setDeviceLocale(Locale deviceLocale)
        Sets the preferred device locale.

        This will be the locale that is preferred when requesting content from your Zendesk. Please note that the preferred locale may not be available in your Zendesk and the actual locale that is used will be specified in HelpCenterSettings.getLocale()

      • setCoppaEnabled

        public void setCoppaEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether we should enable COPPA mode.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true to enable COPPA mode, false otherwise.

      • isCoppaEnabled

        public boolean isCoppaEnabled()
        Gets whether we are in COPPA mode or not.
        Returns:
        true if COPPA mode is enabled, false otherwise.
